metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10011 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
authfile.c in sshd in OpenSSH before 7.4 does not properly consider theeffects of realloc on buffer contents, which might allow local users toobtain sensitive private-key information by leveraging access to aprivilege-separated child process.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10011` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openssh-client - 1:7.4p1-1
openssh-server - 1:7.4p1-1
openssh-sftp-server - 1:7.4p1-1
openssh-tests - 1:7.4p1-1
ssh - 1:7.4p1-1
ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:7.4p1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssh package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:7.4p1-1').
